'OrthoDB' presents a catalog of orthologous protein-
coding genes across vertebrates, arthropods, fungi, and bacteria. Orthology
refers to the last common ancestor of the species under consideration, and thus
OrthoDB explicitly delineates orthologs at each radiation along the species
phylogeny. The database of orthologs presents available protein descriptors,
together with Gene Ontology and InterPro attributes, which serve to provide
general descriptive annotations of the orthologous groups, and facilitate
comprehensive orthology database querying. OrthoDB also provides computed
evolutionary traits of orthologs, such as gene duplicability and loss profiles,
divergence rates, and sibling groups, now extended to detail intron-exon
architectures, syntenic orthologs, and parent-child trees.
